<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/coronavirus-fears-sink-stocks-treasury-yields?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Choose Your Cliché Headline: "Markets Get Sick" or "Markets Have Case of the Mondays"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NYSE with a mask on " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNTg1ODE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stocks had one of their worst days in years yesterday and coronavirus cases spiked outside of China. Probably not a coincidence. The S&P missed the red memo and headed straight for crimson, closing down 3.4% in its largest percentage drop since Feb. 2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But stocks are just one piece of the markets puzzle, and that pesky inverted yield curve is back and worrying economists.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's going on </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When a threat like coronavirus puts economic growth at risk, investors pig pile into safer assets like government bonds. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which brings us to yesterday, when yields on longer-term Treasury notes <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-24/virus-fears-flatten-yield-curves-in-worrisome-growth-warning?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell below yields</a> on shorter-term notes—there’s your “inversion.” The gap between the 3-month and 10-year Treasury notes inverted to minus-18 basis points.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Fed uses that gap as an indicator of economic downturns. Over the last half century, such yield curve inversions have </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/58317c6c-571d-11ea-a528-dd0f971febbc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preceded every recession</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is the deepest inversion since last October and the third in the last few months. Which means something eerie could be lurking underneath a generally well-returning stock market.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"A lot of investors have been worried for a while that the bond market knows something that stocks don't," Leuthold Group Chief Investment Strategist Jim Paulsen told the FT. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>"Bond investors are sending the strongest signal yet that they doubt central banks will be able to avert a recession or revive inflation as the coronavirus's spread darkens growth prospects," writes Bloomberg.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fed’s indicated it wants to keep rates steady this year, but many investors are betting the coronavirus will push it to make additional rate cuts to keep the economy on track. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The WHO <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/24/who-says-its-too-early-to-declare-a-coronavirus-pandemic-now-is-the-time-to-prepare.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clarified yesterday</a> that coronavirus is not a pandemic...but maybe "it is time to do everything you would do in preparing for a pandemic." Per Oxford Economics data cited by the FT, if the virus escalates to that level it could cut global GDP by $1.1 trillion.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F24%2Fcoronavirus-fears-sink-stocks-treasury-yields" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=This+is+the+deepest+inversion+since+last+October&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/coronavirus-fears-sink-stocks-treasury-yields&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
#METOO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/weinstein-convicted-momentous-metoo-moment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Weinstein Convicted in Momentous #MeToo Moment
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Harvey Weinstein enters a Manhattan court house as a jury continues with deliberations in his trial on February 24, 2020 in New York City. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNTg1ODExLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Spencer Platt via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harvey Weinstein was found guilty of rape and a criminal sexual act by a New York jury yesterday. As the AP reports, the convictions <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/24/harvey-weinstein-found-guilty-in-landmark-metoo-moment-117129?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sealed</a> Weinstein's "dizzying fall from powerful Hollywood studio boss to archvillain of the #MeToo movement."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While Weinstein was found guilty on two counts, he was acquitted on three of the most serious charges, including predatory sexual assault. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Since the first allegations surfaced against Weinstein in fall 2017, at least 90 women have accused Weinstein of sexual misconduct including unwanted touching and forced oral sex. As an influential business figure, Weinstein <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/24/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-trial-rape-verdict.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became the face</a> of the #MeToo movement, which aims to hold powerful men accountable for sexual harassment in the workplace. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Weinstein will be sentenced on March 11, and he'll face up to 29 years behind bars. Weinstein's attorney is appealing the decision.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ Read the October 2017 investigations that started it all.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/05/us/harvey-weinstein-harassment-allegations.html?action=click&pgtype=Article&state=default&module=styln-weinstein-verdict&variant=show&region=TOP_BANNER&context=storyline_menu&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Harvey Weinstein Paid Off Sexual Harassment Accusers for Decades</a></span><span>" in the NYT.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"</span><span><a href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/from-aggressive-overtures-to-sexual-assault-harvey-weinsteins-accusers-tell-their-stories?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">From Aggressive Overtures to Sexual Assault: Harvey Weinstein's Accusers Tell Their Stories</a></span><span><span>" in The New Yorker.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/austin-tx-tops-wsj-rankings-hottest-us-job-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Build a Whole Foods in 1980 and Eventually They'll Come
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="A photo of Austin's skyline" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTc1L2FfcGhvdG9fb2ZfYXVzdGluX3Nfc2t5bGluZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>KBaucherel via Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Austin, TX, keeps trying to convince itself it's still "weird," when it should just embrace what it is...a booming tech hub. The Texas capital was the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/austin-nashville-rank-at-top-of-hottest-u-s-job-markets-11582545600?mod=hp_lead_pos8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hottest job market</a> in the U.S. for the second straight year in 2019, per the WSJ. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Home to the first Whole Foods and the University of Texas's flagship campus, Austin has managed to hook some of the most impressive (and high-paying) tech employers in the country. Apple's building a $1 billion campus that will employ up to 15,000 people...on top of the 7,000 Austinites already on Apple payroll.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Classic methodology bullet:</strong></span><span> The Journal created the list using Moody's Analytics data that tracked metrics such as wage growth, unemployment rate, and bachelorette party frequency. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's the rest of the job market rankings for U.S. metros with 1+ million people…</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Austin, TX,</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nashville, TN</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Denver, CO (it was ninth last year)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Seattle, WA</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>San Francisco, CA</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Salt Lake City, UT</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Raleigh, NC</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Orlando, FL</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dallas, TX</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>San Jose, CA</span></li>
</ol>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/study-shows-average-male-worker-can-no-longer-cover-family-expenses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trying to Explain the Disconnect in the Economy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a Brew reader, you know that recent numbers about job growth and living standards show a rip-roaring economy. So why are American families struggling to pay the bills? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A <a href="https://www.manhattan-institute.org/reevaluating-prosperity-of-american-family?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new study</a> from the Manhattan Institute, a conservative think tank, set out to answer that question. It found that a typical male worker's annual income no longer covers a family of four's major expenditures: housing, healthcare, transportation, and college. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Data viz gurus <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/02/24/this-chart-is-best-explanation-middle-class-finances-you-will-ever-see/?utm_source=morning_brew#comments-wrapper?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at the WaPo</a> took those numbers and created this colorful chart.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-apps/imrs.php?src=https://arc-anglerfish-washpost-prod-washpost.s3.amazonaws.com/public/KD2E3LARMFDD5OZZGGR727662Q.png&w=1440" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="A graph of annual household expenditures for a family of four vs. median male income, 1985-2018"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know you're wondering: </strong>The researchers say they focused on men’s wages because empirical research has identified the "unique importance of work" to men's well-being and family stability. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Whether we </span><span><em>should</em></span><span> focus on men being able to provide for their families is outside the paper's scope, the researchers say. The point is...men could and now they cannot. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Price increases as measured by inflation don't take into account real-life economic realities. That's led to a discrepancy between an economist’s view of the economy and the typical American family's. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/netflix-rolls-top-10-lists?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Next Netflix Hole May Be Your Last
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of the Narrator in Fight Club watching TV" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=449 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JQtjrjz75ttYY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of the Narrator in Fight Club watching TV" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JQtjrjz75ttYY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ever watched a documentary on Netflix and wondered, "Is anyone else finding this deep dive into Czech orthodontia scandals as fascinating as I am?" </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wonder no more. Netflix <a href="https://media.netflix.com/en/company-blog/see-whats-popular-on-netflix?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said yesterday</a> it will roll out top 10 lists that show the most popular movies and TV series on the platform. The lists will update daily so "you can easily see what's in the zeitgeist."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Netflix said it's been testing the lists in Mexico and the U.K. for over six months.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Members in both countries have found them useful, so we are now rolling them out to even more," it said matter-of-factly.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Netflix is <a href="https://www.thewrap.com/netflix-top-10-list-feature-most-popular-tv-shows-movies/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">famously protective</a> of viewership data, and famously inconsistent about how it measures it. Last December, Netflix released its most popular movies and TV shows of 2019, but those numbers were calculated differently than the way Netflix previously counted a "view." Plus, no third-party is verifying the data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These top 10 lists present an interesting thought experiment, though. How will seeing the most popular shows on Netflix influence what you watch?</p>

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Business Casual logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MzcwMDU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you survived the 2019 IPO season, you learned two things: 1) Morning Brew’s tailgates rivaled D3’s finest and 2) the only guaranteed win was investing in software as a service (SaaS) companies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">podcast</strong>, we speak to Squarespace Founder and CEO Anthony Casalena to unpack why SaaS companies are doing so well right now, and what it’ll take to stop all that forward momentum. We also talked about...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How businesses build “sticky” models</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why the relationship between customer acquisition and customer value matters </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When it’s better to buy than build</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because in the last few years, we’ve seen a boom in “plug-and-play” models—businesses whose divine purpose is to make creating <em>another</em> business as easy as possible. Why now, and what comes next?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen here to get the answer:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Casalena_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Casalena_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Casalena_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/24/coronavirus-fears-sink-stocks-treasury-yields?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nChoose Your Cliché Headline: \"Markets Get Sick\" or \"Markets Have Case of the Mondays\"\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"NYSE with a mask on \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNTg1ODE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStocks had one of their worst days in years yesterday and coronavirus cases spiked outside of China. Probably not a coincidence. The S\u0026P missed the red memo and headed straight for crimson, closing down 3.4% in its largest percentage drop since Feb. 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut stocks are just one piece of the markets puzzle, and that pesky inverted yield curve is back and worrying economists.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's going on \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen a threat like coronavirus puts economic growth at risk, investors pig pile into safer assets like government bonds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich brings us to yesterday, when yields on longer-term Treasury notes \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-24/virus-fears-flatten-yield-curves-in-worrisome-growth-warning?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell below yields\u003c/a\u003e on shorter-term notes—there’s your “inversion.” The gap between the 3-month and 10-year Treasury notes inverted to minus-18 basis points.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Fed uses that gap as an indicator of economic downturns. Over the last half century, such yield curve inversions have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/58317c6c-571d-11ea-a528-dd0f971febbc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreceded every recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is the deepest inversion since last October and the third in the last few months. Which means something eerie could be lurking underneath a generally well-returning stock market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"A lot of investors have been worried for a while that the bond market knows something that stocks don't,\" Leuthold Group Chief Investment Strategist Jim Paulsen told the FT. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003e\"Bond investors are sending the strongest signal yet that they doubt central banks will be able to avert a recession or revive inflation as the coronavirus's spread darkens growth prospects,\" writes Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fed’s indicated it wants to keep rates steady this year, but many investors are betting the coronavirus will push it to make additional rate cuts to keep the economy on track. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe WHO \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/24/who-says-its-too-early-to-declare-a-coronavirus-pandemic-now-is-the-time-to-prepare.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclarified yesterday\u003c/a\u003e that coronavirus is not a pandemic...but maybe \"it is time to do everything you would do in preparing for a pandemic.\" Per Oxford Economics data cited by the FT, if the virus escalates to that level it could cut global GDP by $1.1 trillion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHarvey Weinstein was found guilty of rape and a criminal sexual act by a New York jury yesterday. As the AP reports, the convictions \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/24/harvey-weinstein-found-guilty-in-landmark-metoo-moment-117129?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esealed\u003c/a\u003e Weinstein's \"dizzying fall from powerful Hollywood studio boss to archvillain of the #MeToo movement.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile Weinstein was found guilty on two counts, he was acquitted on three of the most serious charges, including predatory sexual assault. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eSince the first allegations surfaced against Weinstein in fall 2017, at least 90 women have accused Weinstein of sexual misconduct including unwanted touching and forced oral sex. As an influential business figure, Weinstein \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/24/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-trial-rape-verdict.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame the face\u003c/a\u003e of the #MeToo movement, which aims to hold powerful men accountable for sexual harassment in the workplace. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eWeinstein will be sentenced on March 11, and he'll face up to 29 years behind bars. Weinstein's attorney is appealing the decision.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ Read the October 2017 investigations that started it style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTrying to Explain the Disconnect in the Economy\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs a Brew reader, you know that recent numbers about job growth and living standards show a rip-roaring economy. So why are American families struggling to pay the bills? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://www.manhattan-institute.org/reevaluating-prosperity-of-american-family?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew study\u003c/a\u003e from the Manhattan Institute, a conservative think tank, set out to answer that question. It found that a typical male worker's annual income no longer covers a family of four's major expenditures: housing, healthcare, transportation, and college. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eData viz gurus \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/02/24/this-chart-is-best-explanation-middle-class-finances-you-will-ever-see/?utm_source=morning_brew#comments-wrapper?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e took those numbers and created this colorful chart.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-apps/imrs.php?src=https://arc-anglerfish-washpost-prod-washpost.s3.amazonaws.com/public/KD2E3LARMFDD5OZZGGR727662Q.png\u0026w=1440\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"A graph of annual household expenditures for a family of four vs. median male income, 1985-2018\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know you're wondering: \u003c/strong\u003eThe researchers say they focused on men’s wages because empirical research has identified the \"unique importance of work\" to men's well-being and family stability. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhether we \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eshould\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e focus on men being able to provide for their families is outside the paper's scope, the researchers say. The point is...men could and now they cannot. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003ePrice increases as measured by inflation don't take into account real-life economic realities. That's led to a discrepancy between an economist’s view of the economy and the typical American family's. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEver watched a documentary on Netflix and wondered, \"Is anyone else finding this deep dive into Czech orthodontia scandals as fascinating as I am?\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWonder no more. Netflix \u003ca href=\"https://media.netflix.com/en/company-blog/see-whats-popular-on-netflix?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid yesterday\u003c/a\u003e it will roll out top 10 lists that show the most popular movies and TV series on the platform. The lists will update daily so \"you can easily see what's in the zeitgeist.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNetflix said it's been testing the lists in Mexico and the U.K. for over six months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Members in both countries have found them useful, so we are now rolling them out to even more,\" it said matter-of-factly.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eNetflix is \u003ca href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/netflix-top-10-list-feature-most-popular-tv-shows-movies/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efamously protective\u003c/a\u003e of viewership data, and famously inconsistent about how it measures it. Last December, Netflix released its most popular movies and TV shows of 2019, but those numbers were calculated differently than the way Netflix previously counted a \"view.\" Plus, no third-party is verifying the data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese top 10 lists present an interesting thought experiment, though.
